text: My wife and I were recently driving across country toward Montreal and spent the night in Laval. We had no idea where to eat but checked out Yelp to see what might be in the area. We decided on this restaurant. You should go here!! We were very happy with the delicious food but also impressed with friendly and personalized service from the owner and his staff. This place is definitely worth checking out ! We were so happy! They also do catering! Too bad they don't deliver in the USA !
Délicieux! Peut resto de pâtes fraîches maison sans flafla! Seul bémol ces n'est pas du parmesan frais qui nous est offert mais bon! C'est pas si grave on y r tourne sans hésiter .

So I finally gave this overlooked place a try after some prejudiced hesitation fabricated by none other than my skeptic mind. But upon the recommendation of a Yelp friend and the positive reviews, I decided to find out for myself.   The place is small with 4-5 tables, casual, laid back and clean. Staff are young and nice, pasta is freshly prepared behind the counter where you can clearly see the guy playing with the dough then making sheets out of it in the machine to be cut into different shapes and sizes later. Yeah, just like a grown up kid with Play Dough :)  Had a lunch there and tried the tagliatelle con agnello which was the special of the day and not found in their regular menu. This changes everyday and it was recommended by the waiter. I was hesitating between that or a plate with no meat but with the good sales pitch and the assurance of the waiter that the lamb won't give off that nasty "lamby" maaa maaaa  icky smell/taste and also seeing 3 plates of this landing on the table next to me, I told the waiter let's do it... and make it extra spicy.   The plate comes and looks good. As usual, I try a cube of the braised lamb first in there to make sure it doesn't stink and yessss, it didn't. The rest of the ingredients in there were just fine also,  nicely put in terms of freshness, correct sauce quantity and overall taste. I asked it to be extra spicy and it's like the waiter knew my sweet spot of spiciness level for that plate without going over or under it. Good job. Overall rating of the plate is 5/5 so is the price which was only $10 plus tax. You'll get a plate of pasta (some sauces are $3 extra), fresh bread and a bottle of water. Not too bad for a nice and healthy lunch.   Definitely I'd go back to try their other plates. I can tell they'll be all good as well. Having said that, I won't leave it there without adding a few of my observations and in a hope that they'll be taken as a constructive criticism just to help the owner make the experience a little more pleasant hence enlarging his client base.    In my opinion:  1)- They should have a simple menu with pictures to facilitate the choice of visual people who usually like to see the pic of what they'll consume instead of reading the titles of the plates on the walls with no prices. I don't know, yes their menu is simple but I felt a bit awkward turning my neck 180 degrees to read what the menu is on the wall and which took me a while to decide in that position. Plus it'd look more professional by avoiding the embarrassment of asking the waiter how much is this or how much is that.  2)- Lower the volume of the music just a tad which was coming out of a big speaker parked only three feet away from my table. This felt a bit intruding. May be install some speakers on the ceiling and set the volume to a level that it feels like a background music? 3)- Some salt and black pepper shakers on the tables perhaps? None of the tables had these standard items.  4)- Please remove the $1.50 water bottle handwritten on the other menu. Yes I  wasn't charged for it but I think water should be a standard thing in a restaurant also. Giving customers bottle water instead of tap water, is  the owner's choice which should be free.   Again, an overall nice place for a very good and healthy pasta dishes. Keep up the good job guys!

On m'avait prévenu que le resto ne ressemble à rien de dehors, mais que la nourriture y est fabuleuse. Oh que c'est vrai!  Nous avions réservé le restaurant complet pour notre groupe (15 personnes) un samedi soir. C'est ce qu'ils font lorsque des groupes réservent puisque l'espace est limité. Dans ce cas, nous pouvions choisir notre menu genre buffet parmi une bonne sélection de plats relativement abordables. Ceci nous a permis de goûter à plusieurs mets en même temps. Le restaurant n'a pas de permis d'alcool. Vous pouvez, avec l'accord de ce dernier, en faire venir un pour votre soirée en faisant une demande auprès de la régie des alcools, des courses et des jeux.  Bon, la nourriture... je pense manquer de mot tellement tout était frais et bon! En entrée, nous avons commencé avec des calmars (les meilleurs que j'ai mangé jusqu'à maintenant), des boulettes de poulet à la cacciatore (à se rouler par-terre), une salade de betteraves et une salade de fenouil (les deux vraiment excellentes). Une pizza froide et un gros pain focaccia complétait le tout. Ça commençait très bien!  Les plats principaux étaient des moules (juste parfaites avec une merveilleuse sauce), une lasagne (wow) et du buf braisé (fantastique). En accompagnement, nous avions des légumes grillés bien assaisonnés et des patates douces au fromage de chèvre!   Nous avons fini avec la pizza au Nutella (j'ai probablement versé une larme en mangeant ça) et des fruis frais (vraiment frais).  Ce qui surprend de ce resto, c'est la qualité et la fraîcheur des mets. Presque tout a été cuisiné devant nous. Le restaurant est très propre et le service courtois.  À voir le service pour les groupes, nous avons déjà hâte d'utiliser le service traiteur de Pasta da Panza pour nos soirées à la maison!
Great find!! Food is authentic and extremely fresh and good!!! Would give more stars if i could!!!

Hey, what's your favourite pasta? Is it spaghetti, tortellini, gnocchi? I'm sure you have a preference and so with a broad choice of 11 different pastas and 11 different sauces you won't go hungry here - promise! Last time we dined here, with a group of 10, we all literally rolled out after our meals.  Pasta da Panza is helmed by second wave young Italian Chef Lucio Panza and silently strong and lovely sous-chef Gena. Lucio is one of a few emerging local chefs that are taking Italian cuisine into the modern world by drawing on the best of the past, each their own way.  Here you'll find classic Italian homemade pasta and sauces with a  slight modern twist. My favourite is Gnocchi with the vibrant and bright tomato sauce (no meat please), second is Pappardelle with Arrabbiata sauce, aromatic with just enough of spiciness, that you can easily kick it up with a side of spicy oil, and third is Linguine Carbonara, which is incredibly creamy despite the fact that there isn't a drop of cream in it - amazing!  Here's a shortlist of pastas and sauces so you can build your 121 possible combinations:  Spaghetti  Tagliatelle  Fettuccine  Pappardelle Fusilli  Rigatoni Cavatelli Gnocchi  Gnocchi (sweet potato) Ravioli Tortellini  Cannelloni Fazzoletti  Bognese (beef, veal, pork) Tomato Cacio e pepe  Rosé (Cream, Tomato, Parmesan) Arrabiata (Spicy Tomato) Shrimp Pesto and Basil Aglio e Olio Mushroom Ragoût Carbonara (bacon, eggs, parmesan) Amtriciana (pancetta, onion, tomato   What's special here is the fact that Pasta is freshly prepared right on spot from scratch, flattened, cut and cooked on order. One more thing, do try the amazing polpette (meatballs) and ask for the flatbread with olive oil and balsamic reduction - yummy!  Although the atmosphere is atypical from what you'd expect in a classic restaurant, meaning no Italian music, no pictures from the country nor other memorabilia, the spectre of the silver-haired Nonna still haunts everything that comes out of the kitchen. Call it the 'umbilical cord' factor, where ties to old world, such as simplicity, direct, honest flavours are present in every dish prepared with a whole lot of love.  Note: this sparsely decorated, unassuming restaurant is located at the far left of a tiny strip mall and is easy to miss - keep your eyes open or have a spotter while driving. It's literally a real hidden gem in all of its meanings.  Come and try it for yourself, order take out or have it catered and tell me about your experience!
After being away from Italy for 2 months we finally found this place with delicious fresh made pasta and the salads are great too!!

Feels and tastes like Italy. Great food, service and ambience. The handmade pasta is made freshly on the spot. I've tried at least 8 different pasta dishes and each was better than the other. Dessert is great as well. Must try the pupilo.

Cet endroit vaut vraiment le détour! Les portions sont généreuses. De la bouffe de grand-mère faite avec amour. On utilise visiblement des ingrédients de qualité, préparés dans la plus pure tradition italienne. Les pâtes fraîches sont façonnées avec soin par le personnel attentionné à la commande. J'ai été conquise par les "polpete", tendres et savoureuses. La sauce est comme elle se doit.  Essayez le tiramisu si vous en avez la chance, un vrai délice!

Wow, quale buon piatto di pasta!  It's really an hidden gem. It's so cheap while being so good. Where is the catch?  I was a bit reluctant to go out to eat pasta, I mean, it's what you eat when you don,t have the time to cook anything else right? But that's not it. These are real fresh handmade pasta. It's a completely different thing. A completely great different thing.  The portion aren't really big, but it's to be expected with handmade pasta and such low prices.  There is nothing much else to say. Good pasta, good service and good prices.
OMG ces pâtes sont divines et à un prix vraiment abordable!! Il y en a pour tous les goûts et il y a aussi des options végé. Essayez, vous ne serez pas déçus!!

Les pâtes fraîches et sauces maison de Lucio sont sublimes, on peut manger sur place les pâtes du jour très originales, aux goûts surprenants, des salades succulentes servis avec foccacia aussi maison ou apporter et faire des provisions de produits d'importations d'excellentes qualités, j'adore les artichauts et les cerises au grand Marnier. Les prix sont très abordables considérant la qualité et la fraîcheur des ingrédients choisis par Lucio. Un petit détour qui en vaut le coup.

Fuck fuck fuck it is sooo good I wish I had the time to come back and eat more of there homemade pasta, you can watch them how they make it, and today they had a fennel orange salat uhhhhhhhh yuuumyyyy , this guys know how to make real italien tasty foood, thx for this. See you next time I'm visit your town

This is kind of experience I love using "Yelp" for!  Dead on food and service.  Great authentic Italian fair prepared by a chef passionate about his art!  Brought me back to Italy in a single bite.  I had the gnocchi with Bolognese...my first choice in a Italian joint by which I gauge the authenticity of the experience.  Nice, light, fluffy, addictive gnocchi!  It is small humble restaurant....don't let this small strip mall location keep you away from the magic of this chef!  Will I be back? You bet, I am already looking forward  to my next business trip to Montreal/Laval

This is probably one of the best pasta restaurant in Montreal-Laval. Reminds me of Italy! Many choices of sauce and pasta, all made fresh right in front of you. I chose the bolognese sauce with gnocchi and it was heaven in my mouth! Tried their dessert and it was also very good! Must gooo =)

Des pâtes succulentes et pour tous les goûts ! Lors de la préparation les pâtes sont faites devant soit.   Les sauces maisons sont juste une tuerie pour les papilles (surtout la rosé).  Je recommande 1000 fois.  Et oui je peux le dire... les pâtes c'est la vie :-)

Pasta da Panza doesn't look like much from the outside but once you come in you'll be surprised by how tightly things are being run, the quality of the food and the service you receive dealing with them.  This establishment is firstly an Italian caterer but they also serve food for patrons like myself who stumble inside. The food is freshly prepared and I excitedly waited for my meal to be cooked. I went with their daily special which was rigatoni and sausage with rapini. I generously coated my plate with freshly shredded Parmesan and went to town.  As someone who grew up eating Italian on practically a daily basis my expectations were high but I'll be pleased to report that the food here is authentic and made fresh. The plate was delicious and I had to stop myself from licking the plate. #Delicious  Mom would be proud.... but don't tell her....  My coworker went with their polpette (meatballs) and he's been busting my chops about going back almost on a daily basis.  Pasta da Panza caters as well and we're pretty excited on possibly using them in a few months for one of our community lunches at work.  The price-tag for lunch was a good deal and I hope they're to stay as I'd like to come here on a bi-weekly basis and enjoy some more of their pasta.

Après maintes recommandations je suis finalement allée à la découverte de Pasta Da Panza. certes, ça a pas l'air de grand chose de dehors, mais c'est tellement pas ça qui importe. On m'a suggéré de rencontrer Lucio, je m'attendais à rencontrer un vieil Italien, mais non, Lucio est un jeune homme dans la vingtaine qui a juste vraiment maîtrisé l'art de la cuisine italienne.  J'ai pris des pâtes fraîches et quand je dit fraîches, elles ont été faites devant moi, et deux pots de sauce. De quoi goûter à plus d'une chose tsé!  Des tortellini, mozzarella et ricotta avec une sauce rosée pour 2 + des gnocchi avec une sauce bolonaise pour 2. Incroyable, y'a pas d'autre mots! Et pour moins de 23$!! Les pâtes sont légéres et la sauce est très savoureuse et fraîche. La sauce rosée est de loin, la meilleure que j'aie mangée! Même si j'habite loin, c'est sûr que j'y retourne bientôt.  Merci Lucio, gros coup de coeur pour tes plats!

Ok, je suis rarement satisfaite des pâtes dans les restos. Ce restaurant m'a été conseillé par un autre membre Elite. QUELLE découverte!!!!   Petit resto, difficile à trouver si on ne fait que rouler sur le boulevard. Il y a une 10-15 de places assises. Le restaurant est décoré très simplement. On y va pour la bouffe et non pas pour l'ambiance et pour le décor.   Je crois que c'est un restaurant idéal pour les dîners rapides.   La nourriture est tout simplement excellente. Avant le repas, une foccaccia est servi avec de l'huile d'olive et du balsamique. Je n'aime généralement pas le foccaccia mais celui-ci était délicieux et moelleux.  Ils y servent pratiquement toutes les sortes de pâtes. Du simple spaghetti au gnocchi à la patate douce. À l'arrivée du plat on peut penser que c'est une petite portion, toutefois vous serez rassasié, croyez-moi. Le chef prépare les pâtes lors de la commande, malgré cela, le service est rapide. Tous les choix sont bons. Utilisez l'huile piquante qu'ils mettent sur la table pour ajouter un petit oumf supplémentaire à votre plat.    vous pouvez acheter des pâtes et des sauces pour faire à la maison. De plus, ils ont un service de traiteur. Les prix sont très abordables.     Bémol : le look, le resto ferme à 19:00, donc pour ces deux points on oublie les souper en tête à tête avec lumière tamisée. Toutefois, il pourrait y avoir un potentiel. Avec le manque de bon resto italien abordable à Laval, celui-ci pourrait faire fureur en étant un peu plus grand, avec un look un peu plus attirant et en étant BYOW.

Let me preface this review. In 2014 I had the awesome opportunity to visit Italy. Previous to this trip sure I've eaten spaghetti with meat sauce all my life a bit of carbonara and other wonderful pasta dishes. Italian food is one of the main staples of a North American diet. I guarantee it that 90+% of people who grow up in North America have at least one Italian dish either pizza or pasta which is part of their regular weekly/monthly diet. Visiting Italy however changed my perception of Italian food. The flavours with their simplicity. The textures and the sauces. Pure deliciousness.  After Italy I did not think I could find something that would match my experiences.   Then one day my good friend brought me here mentioning it was the real deal. Sure I was skeptical. It's tucked away in a small plaza on the N side of St. Martin. If you drive fast it's easily missed.   At Pasta de Panza you choose your pasta (freshly made) and your sauce to accompany. My first visit I had the carbonara with Pancetta. The second time I had Aglio e oglio. The third visit I had a fresh pesto pasta. They even have the Roman specialty Caico E Pepe. Never and I repeat never have I seen this on a menu in North America. I will come out boldly and say this is the closest pasta I've had to my experiences in Italy. They are freshly made by Chef Lucio. We are talking fresh (not dried) pasta and from scratch sauce. The sauces are incredible and they have these hot peppers in oil that I go crazy over. It's a healthy portion for lunch and a rich meal but so amazingly delish. A pasta lunch will run you in the range of $14-19 with tax and tip w drink.   They do have catering services (for larger group parties or office lunches). Ask for their catering menu. I've introduced a few friends at work to Pasta De Panza. My colleagues ordered it last week and they claimed it was wonderful.   Also available to take home are portions of their freshly made pasta plus their bolognese sauce. I've taken the bolognese sauce home three times and the family is more than satisfied.   A hidden gem in Laval. You won't be dissapointed.

Ce n'est pas la première fois que je vais à ce restaurant.  En faite j'y suis allé après avoir entendu une recommandation via un nouveau site.. Yelp... Ben oui à 55 ans ont découvrent encore plein de belles choses sur le le web :-). Passons aux commentaires à propos du resto. Mon épouse avait réservé le restaurant en soirée pour une fête en famille.  Imaginez avoir six entrées en commençant! Puis un le choix de plus de quatre repas différents tous en format buffet et un dessert à vous faire saliver comme jamais. Le personnel du restaurant était affable et avenant.  La bouffe était exceptionnelle. Tout étais frais et bon.  Pas du réchauffer aux microondes comme à certains endroits! En plus tout ce nous avons pu repartir avec les restes.  Pour en manger davantage la journée d'après. (Yeah!) Je recommande cet endroit vivement et je comprends pourquoi tous les commentaires montrent cinq étoiles.  c'est vraiment un secret fantastique à découvrir.
Excellente table de pâte, des sauces extra à recommander. Ne paye pas de mines, service sympa et sans fioritures
First time but definitely won't be my last. Went today with my boyfriend and we had the Freshly made tortellini rose and the gnocchi mushroom Raghu. Phenomenal. You taste the freshness.
